results.text: Welcome home, Mr. President: Wheels down, White House. http://t.co/ddKi6AuE
President Obama’s sign-off after 8 states in 48 hours: “Don’t quit. Let’s make sure we run through the tape.” http://t.co/HmuKWpvZ
I spy ... the President of the United States of America. http://t.co/jTOZZzzH
President Obama in Cleveland: “We’ve come too far to turn back now.” http://t.co/dIqawqOV
President Obama: "I'm honored to be the first sitting president who has ever early voted." http://t.co/6458WgfS
Thank you, OH, IL, VA, FL, CA, NV, CO, and IA. These last 48 hours have me feeling ready to go for the next 11 days. Are you with me? -bo
If you missed Air Force One rolling up to President Obama's final tour stop in Cleveland, it was pretty epic: http://t.co/moiRkjEB
“If you give me your vote, I promise you will continue to have a president who hears your voices. A president who fights for your families.”
President Obama: "Ohio, I believe in you, and I need you to keep believing in me." #AmericaForward
"Our destiny is not written for us, it's written by us. And we can write that next chapter together." —President Obama
"We don't look backwards, we look forward." —President Obama
"You can make it here in America if you try. That's who we are. That's who we're fighting for." #AmericaForward
"We all have a place in America if you're willing to work hard, if you're willing to stand up."—President Obama
President Obama: "We can choose the policies that give us the prospect of broad-based prosperity." #AmericaForward
President Obama: "It's up to the young people who are here to choose the future that you want." #AmericaForward
President Obama: "It's now up to you to choose the path that we take." #AmericaForward
Obama: “I wasn't going to let Detroit go bankrupt. Or Toledo go bankrupt. Or Lordstown go bankrupt. I bet on American workers.”
“If Romney had been president when the American auto industry was on the verge of collapse, we might not have an American auto industry.”
"Whatever the symptoms are, don't worry—Obamacare covers pre-existing conditions."—President Obama on Romnesia
"In the closing moments of the election, Gov. Romney's hoping you too will come down with a severe case of Romnesia." —President Obama
Obama on Romney: “He’s hoping that you come down with a case of what we call…” Crowd: “Romnesia!”
President Obama: “I've come to Ohio today to ask you for your vote. I need your vote, and I need your help to move this country forward.”
"Even though I've been going for 38 hours straight ... I've still got a spring in my step because our cause is right." #AmericaForward
Obama: "We just made a quick stop in Chicago so I could vote." #GottaVote
President Obama: "We've been from the east coast to the west coast, and now we're going back east again." #AmericaForward
President Obama: “Hello, Ohio! Are you fired up? Are you ready to go?” #AmericaForward
Watch President Obama speak live from Cleveland, the last stop on the #AmericaForward tour: http://t.co/9cxh8qNh
Election-year flair on display in Cleveland: http://t.co/E0NffxZF
From President Obama, three things: http://t.co/T803SlOv
Cleveland: Crowd, tarmac, setting sun. http://t.co/9148gvsp
#AmericaForward high-five count: 3. http://t.co/WWMjl5UQ
Rosemary's fired up to see the President in Cleveland, OH: http://t.co/NYBBXXTr
The crowd gathers at President Obama's next and final stop: Cleveland, Ohio. http://t.co/JouWzNo4
Smile if you've voted early. If you haven’t, find out when you can vote in your state: http://t.co/uBPdsmHG, http://t.co/I7dQPxXT
“Hey, this is Barack!” President Obama makes calls with volunteers in Chicago: http://t.co/5ZmpObF3
Thank you for everything you're doing to make this campaign run. Let's keep going: http://t.co/7Z5yG1rd
Since the beginning of this campaign in April 2011, a total of 4,200,000 people have pitched in to own a piece of it.
Every five bucks helped: More than 98% of contributions were $250 or less, with an average contribution of $46.92.
Of the 1.2 million people who donated, 207,264 people hadn't supported this campaign before.
In the first 17 days of October, 1,251,291 people came together to raise $90,500,000 for the campaign and combined committees.
We're filing our last pre-election FEC report tomorrow, and here's a preview.
President Obama just became the first sitting president to vote early: http://t.co/84ZMwo3e, http://t.co/vlw2IMtC
This afternoon, President Obama will become the first sitting president to vote early. Find out if you can join him: http://t.co/njqUw9Td
RT if you agree: Mitt Romney’s severely conservative views are a disaster for women that we can’t afford in the White House.
President Obama: “Rape is rape. It is a crime.” http://t.co/Z1Pkdu3B
FACT: Romney would take away a woman’s right to choose and even said he’d be “delighted” to sign a bill banning all abortions.
FACT: Rep. Steve King, who Romney called a “partner in Washington,” said he’s never heard of anyone getting pregnant from statutory rape.
FACT: Romney’s running mate Paul Ryan referred to rape as a “method of conception” and co-sponsored a bill to redefine rape with Todd Akin.
Romney’s endorsement of Mourdock is just the latest example of the severely conservative candidates he supports.
Many GOP leaders are cutting ties with Richard Mourdock for his outrageous rape comments—but Romney still supports him: http://t.co/hMczi9yn
Watch President Obama fire up the crowd in Richmond, VA: http://t.co/KjQ14cru #AmericaForward
Find out if you can vote early in your state: http://t.co/8YMe4mms
The President checks in from Richmond, on his way to Chicago to vote early: http://t.co/6fVS7ifS
What a great view, Virginia! My voice might be getting hoarse, but the energy out here is going strong. -bo
Forward, Virginia: http://t.co/YqHCQYO4
How big was the crowd in Richmond? This big: http://t.co/vQWsH3kE #AmericaForward
“Our destiny is not written for us, it’s written by us. And we’re going to write the next chapter together.” http://t.co/YPEI0LTs
Obama: “It’s up to the young people out there to decide what kind of future you want for yourselves.” #AmericaForward
Obama: “I don’t think any male politician should be making health care decisions for women.”
President Obama: “I believe women are capable and should make their own health care decisions for themselves.”
President Obama: “Finally, I’ll use the savings from ending the wars in Afghanistan and Iraq to do some nation-building here at home.”
President Obama: “Number 4: My plan will cut the deficit by $4 trillion in 10 years.” #AmericaForward
President Obama: “Number 3: I want to make it a national mission to educate our young people, to train our workers.”
Obama: “Number 2: I want to cut our oil imports in half by 2020 so we control more of our own energy.”
President Obama: “The first thing in my plan: I want to end tax breaks for companies that ship jobs overseas.”
“I've got a plan that will actually create jobs, not just talk about creating jobs. A plan that will actually create middle-class security.”
President Obama: “Trust matters. You want to know that whoever’s in the Oval Office is going to fight for you.”
President Obama: "I've come to ask for your help in keeping America moving forward."
On voting early today: “I can’t tell you who I’m voting for because it’s a secret ballot. The good news is, Michelle said she voted for me.”
President Obama in VA: “My voice sounds just a little hoarse. We are right in the middle of our 8-state, fly-around campaign extravaganza.”
Watch live: President Obama speaks in Virginia about the stark choice we face in this election. http://t.co/3KbHDdFq #AmericaForward
Crowds literally as far as the eye can see, waiting for President Obama in Richmond, VA: http://t.co/CIcyFGUX
Four more for number 44: http://t.co/i3rB1MWE
President Obama last night on Richard Mourdock: “I don’t know how these guys come up with these ideas. Rape is rape.” http://t.co/7fD3l0xG
The President talks to @JayLeno about the debates, voting early, and his take on the GOP's policies for women: http://t.co/lH4ZPIJx
Five states down—now off to Virginia. Get the latest from the ground here: http://t.co/DkzulTdU, http://t.co/kaSWqB9d
So long, Florida: http://t.co/c1NFffiB
President Obama explained his plans for a second term in Tampa this morning. Take a look: http://t.co/tAbJVQJX, http://t.co/iv4ps50r
12 days left in the President’s final campaign. Make sure each one counts—get out and volunteer to help win this thing: http://t.co/gmMA5OA4
Colin Powell endorsed President Obama this morning, citing his leadership on jobs, foreign policy, and health care: http://t.co/QnDhKPHH
President Obama welcomes you to day two of his 8-state, 48-hour "campaign extravaganza": http://t.co/s2H2jw0T
Babies for Obama: http://t.co/wCgd0lb8
Obama: "Women should be making their own health care decisions. That’s why the health care law we passed put those choices in your hands."
"I don’t think any politician in Washington, most of whom are male, should be making health care decisions for women." http://t.co/mWL6H2Yy
President Obama: “Trust matters, and Florida, you know me. You know I say what I mean, and I mean what I say.” #AmericaForward
The sun's fully up as the President takes the stage in Tampa. http://t.co/DJKyns2w
A bit of morning shootaround at the firehouse before the day's first event in Tampa: http://t.co/k9AT95B3
"Thank you for everything you guys do." http://t.co/6WtGhwjZ
Palm trees, Tampa crowd await President Obama. http://t.co/aaBtffED
After last night's Vegas event, the President took a minute to share his thoughts on day one of his 48-hour trip: http://t.co/kLu6gH1d
Beat the sun to Tampa. Looking forward to day two of our marathon trip. -bo
This morning: Tampa. President Obama just stopped by a local firehouse, and brought breakfast. http://t.co/shYbNQKl
Four states down, four states to go in the President's 48-hour #AmericaForward tour: today he hits FL, VA, IL, and OH. http://t.co/7Ypvf15a
Leaving Las Vegas—on to Tampa (and day two of this 8-state trip). http://t.co/zLO3mcFm
The President winds up sticking around, gives amazing speech about hard work. Casino staff start spontaneous chant of "four more years."
Amazing/surreal moment in Vegas: POTUS stops to talk to casino workers. Means to just shake a few hands, but word gets out...
Casino staffers in Las Vegas greeting the President: http://t.co/LE2LawCv
President Obama on pulling an all-nighter on this trip: If you're not going to sleep, "you might as well be in Vegas." #AmericaForward
In Las Vegas, last stop of the day: vote early. http://t.co/M8fhz8zf, http://t.co/TK74qMFA
Good night, L.A. http://t.co/jzmHJoE5
